thread.title: ​Sure, We’d Support This Cauliflower-and-Kale Burger From KFC
thread.title_full: ​Sure, We’d Support This Cauliflower-and-Kale Burger From KFC

author: Barry K
title: ​Sure, We’d Support This Cauliflower-and-Kale Burger From KFC

organizations.name: kfc your privacy rights canadian customers  kfc

text:
Your Privacy Rights Canadian Customers 
KFC is beloved by eaters worldwide for one reason and one reason only: It makes delicious and life-destroying fried chicken. No games. No gimmicks (aside from the Double Down). Just dead birds wrapped in breading and plunged into boiling oil. It’s everything we’re not about at Men’s Health, but KFC UK & Ireland tweeted a campaign yesterday to promote a menu item that could change the image of the brand: The KFC Clean-Eating Burger, made in collaboration with blogger Figgy Poppleton-Rice . No word on whether the promotion is real or not (we suspect the latter—Figgy’s website is dubious at best), but in any case, this warrants a too-elaborate ingredient-by-ingredient breakdown. 
Chia-Seeded Cauliflower Bun It appears to be a head of cauliflower sheared flat at the bottom and sprinkled with chia seeds. Nevertheless, this is a great low-carb alternative to the typical grease-soaked bread, and the chia seeds would bring a solid protein boost. Advertisement
